image.altText: Two buildings of the Royal Hobart Hospital with kunanyi/Mount Wellington visible in the background

props.synopsis: Job vacancies across radiology, pathology, nursing and midwifery questioned extensively by Labor and the Greens in response to the Tasmanian government's "vacancy control" measures, leaked last week in an internal Health Department memo.

title.children: Jobs are being left unfilled in Tasmania's public health system — on purpose. The government says it's 'prudent'

image.altText: Kylie dancing with a graphic saying 'how much money my online business made in a week'.

props.synopsis: Women in regional Australia are being funnelled into a multi-level marketing scheme promising a "multiple-six-figure business online" — but the "freedom" they seek comes at a cost.

title.children: Women are being funnelled into a multi-level marketing scheme promising 'financial freedom', but what's the real cost?

image.altText: A dusting of snow covers the rocks at cradle mountain

props.synopsis: Large parts of Australia have woken to their coldest morning of the year over the last two days, and the 'feels-like' temperature has been even more chilly. Here's why.

title.children: Icy blast adds extra chill to Australia's east as BOM reveals 'feels-like' temperature formula

image.altText: A headshot photo of a man aged in his mid forties with a 'mullet' hairstyle.

props.synopsis: A Tasmanian man convicted of attempting to kill his ex-partner and murdering her new boyfriend entered their home in the early hours of the morning and stabbed them, while his own son tried to stop him.

title.children: 'He told me … he'd put me down': Man convicted over stabbing rampage involving former partner and new boyfriend

image.altText: Two black and white images show a young Anthony Albanese and Tony Abbott

props.synopsis: Democracy is built on the right of citizens to voice dissent. A glance at the history of our political leaders' involvement with student protests perhaps goes some way to explaining the response to the pro-Palestine movement on campuses today.

title.children: Two political events unfolding before our eyes this week tell us a story about democracy, and our own leaders

image.altText: HMAS Stalwart berths at the newly built Kuru wharf at HMAS Coonawarra in Darwin, NT.

props.synopsis: Australia's newest warship is undergoing emergency mechanical repairs to address "engine defects", at the same time the navy's only other supply class vessel remains out of service.

title.children: Australia's newest warship breaks down, undergoing emergency mechanical repairs after just 3 years of service

image.altText: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu chairs the weekly cabinet meeting.

props.synopsis: The October 7 attacks united many Israeli politicians and citizens in grief and anger but, after eight months of war, that has changed and right-wing voices now have a larger seat at Benjamin Netanyahu's table.

title.children: Israel's war-time unity is gone, as the region teeters on the brink of another major conflict

image.altText: A woman with short brown hair and glasses speaks in front of a media wall that says "Reserve Bank of Australia".

props.synopsis: Pressure is growing on the Reserve Bank to lift interest rates again as inflation remains stubbornly high, but governor Michele Bullock knows another rate hike all but guarantees a recession.

title.children: The RBA is still on a 'narrow path' to avoid the recession it thinks we don't have to have

image.altText: Chris Minns wearing a high-vis vest

props.synopsis: The NSW government is crowing about its plans for 30,000 new homes, with 44 state-owned sites selected for the extra housing. But state treasurer Daniel Mookhey is remaining tight-lipped about the exact geography of the development sites.

title.children: Why the NSW government is keeping its new housing locations secret

image.altText: A line drawing of a woman cradling a baby with a hospital bed behind.

props.synopsis: Tasmanian mothers have been speaking out on their birth experiences as part of a parliamentary inquiry investigating maternity services in the state.

title.children: Claire planned to have a large family, but a birth injury left her infertile. Hers is one of the stories before an inquiry

image.altText: Signage on a shop front with a red house silhouette that reads Chemist Warehouse.

props.synopsis: The ACCC is wary about the proposed merger of Chemist Warehouse and Sigma Healthcare. But other decisions will matter more for service and prices. They concern pharmacy discounting and location rules, and they'll involve taking on existing owners.

title.children: Why pharmacies could be teetering on an 'Uber' moment

image.altText: The back of a women looking down a dark hallway in shadows

props.synopsis: Women who have left financially abusive situations can be saddled with massive debts they never incurred and advocates say the ATO is often unsympathetic in their pursuit of those funds.

title.children: Abusive partners using tax system as 'weapon'

image.altText: Cold winter in Canberra 2015

props.synopsis: Winter solstice is only a few days away. Here's when and what you can expect from the "shortest day of the year".

title.children: This is why Friday will be the 'shortest day of the year'

image.altText: Amal Ein Alshaiba poses for a photo standing outdoors.

props.synopsis: A survey of immigrant community leaders suggests their members are being hit harder than the wider community by the cost-of-living crisis, but also that they are showing resilience and helping each other.

title.children: As costs have risen, Amal found a solution in her kitchen

image.altText: A firefighter in a yellow jacket and red helmet stands with back to camera among scrub, looking at burning tree

props.synopsis: New research suggests the world's climate change authority has underestimated the severity of future bushfires in Australia.

title.children: IPCC says bushfires will burn longer and more often. A new study points to an even worse outlook

image.altText: Justin Timberlake in front of a grey background.

props.synopsis: Boy band singer-turned-solo star and actor Justin Timberlake has been arrested and charged with a drink-driving offence, according to New York law enforcement officials.

title.children: Singer Justin Timberlake arrested and charged with driving while intoxicated

image.altText: Three images. A woman at a music festival, a cartoon of a superhero, a black and white pic of a young Mick Jagger singing.

props.synopsis: Get your buzzers ready, music fans — it's Spicks and Specks trivia time!

title.children: How well do you know music lyrics? This Spicks and Specks music quiz will put you to the test

image.altText: Three writers - Celeste Ng, Paul Lynch and Christos Tsiolkas- pink background

props.synopsis: The 2023 Booker Prize winner Paul Lynch and bestselling authors Celeste Ng and Christos Tsiolkas reveal the secrets of their reading and writing lives.

title.children: Paul Lynch, Celeste Ng and Christos Tsiolkas reveal the secrets of their reading and writing lives

image.altText: Michael, Rose and Orlyn at the graveside of their mother, Constance Watcho.

props.synopsis: After 87 submissions and many traumatic stories shared by First Nations advocates and families across five states and territories, the last hearing has been held in Melbourne. But there are concerns it will not lead to effective action.

title.children: Calls for further action after Senate inquiry into missing and murdered First Nations women and children

image.altText: A close-up of a man's hands holding a power bill.

props.synopsis: A higher-than-expected bill is enough to give most people a sinking feeling — especially if you don't think it's fair. Here's a breakdown of your rights and how to dispute a bill.

title.children: Think you've been overcharged for electricity? Here's what to do if your bill doesn't look right

image.altText: Rats inside a pallet

props.synopsis: Scurrying down highways and chewing through machinery, rats are already running rampant in outback Queensland — and locals say numbers have already soared past last year's infestation.

title.children: Rats eating car wiring, causing thousands of dollars in damage to landholders in Outback Queensland

image.altText: A fire burns in a living room.

props.synopsis: After more than 450 call-outs in winter last year, Queensland is already seeing a spike in house fires — three of them fatal.

title.children: Winter can be one of the most dangerous times for house fires — and the causes aren't always obvious

image.altText: Forensic police and uniformed officers kneel to examine material in a large bowl.

props.synopsis: Forensic testing will be done to determine whether the bones found on a Coffs Harbour beach are human.

title.children: Suspected human remains found at NSW beach

image.altText: Cricketer David Warner speaks to media at a press conference, talking and holding his hands up

props.synopsis: David Warner says he is relieved that retiring from international cricket will mean silencing the constant "flak" he has copped since the Newlands ball-tampering saga.

title.children: Warner says he was only player who 'copped a lot of flak' over Sandpapergate scandal

image.altText: Cherie Finnerty, domestic violence survivor, No Limits Perth volunteer  2024-06-18

props.synopsis: Women escaping domestic violence often find themselves homeless, and the organisations assisting them are under increasing strain. This survivor is now returning the favour, volunteering for an organisation that once helped her.

title.children: Cherie became homeless escaping domestic violence, now she volunteers at the service that helped her

image.altText: Vladimir Putin hugging Kim Jong Un.

props.synopsis: Russian President Vladimir Putin arrives in North Korea for his first visit in 24 years, vowing to deepen trade and security ties with the reclusive nuclear-armed state.

title.children: Putin embraces 'Comrade' Kim as he makes first North Korea visit in 24 years

image.altText: An artist's interpretation of a highly reflective, circular silver sculpture with people walking in to it.

props.synopsis: Ouroboros by Lindy Lee, based on the ancient tale about a snake swallowing its own tail, was commissioned by the National Gallery of Australia to celebrate its 40th birthday — and its $14 million price tag means it's the single-biggest ever investment in an artwork.

title.children: This 13-tonne, $14 million sculpture spent days on the back of a truck to get to Canberra

image.altText: Cortnee Vine, in yellow shirt and green shorts (her Matildas kit), kicks the winning penalty against France.

props.synopsis: The Matildas winger has signed a three-year deal in the United States, where full-time professionalism and standards are the norm. How should the A-League Women respond?

title.children: Cortnee Vine's departure yet another warning shot for A-Leagues

image.altText: A person sits in a car without touching the wheel

props.synopsis: Self-driving cars are better at routine tasks but are five times more likely to be involved in an accident in low-light.

title.children: Self-driving cars 'generally' safer, but more at risk of accidents at dusk and dawn

image.altText: Peter Dutton during QT

props.synopsis: A snap meeting of Coalition MPs has been called, sparking speculation the opposition could soon reveal its long-awaited nuclear policy.

title.children: Snap Coalition meeting sparks speculation nuclear policy imminent

image.altText: Anthony Albanese seen at a green sporting oval

props.synopsis: The bill could inflame tensions between Labor and some of the union's top brass, such as Victorian state secretary John Setka.

title.children: Federal government to introduce CFMEU-busting legislation to parliament

image.altText: Joe Biden in the Oval office.

props.synopsis: New plans announced by the White House could pave the way for half a million immigrants to obtain permanent residency in the US.

title.children: 500,000 undocumented spouses could get US citizenship under new Biden administration plan

image.altText: Maddison-Lilly Mae Jackson in front of a colourful mural.

props.synopsis: Hundreds of students in Western Sydney have had their schooling turned around by the "homegrown" solution, but the program receives no state funding.

title.children: How a 'homegrown solution' from Sydney's Mount Druitt is helping students re-engage with school
